history.content:
The default on campus is that time conflicts are NOT allowed. In the department, we have often allowed time conflicts when the campus policy was that it was the responsibility of the student to confirm that it would be possible to take both classes without being unable to take both finals.  For Spring 2021 (at least, because of distance learning), campus has made faculty responsible for providing alternate exam times if they allow time conflicts and so most of our instructors have not allowed time conflicts.

When time conflicts are allowed, they are noted in the campus online schedule of classes. For an example, see https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2021-spring-compsci-61c-001-lec-001  

The note in bold on the left is applied automatically whenever conflicts are allowed. The note under "Class Notes" in the center was manually added by department staff and may not always appear.
EECS 16B and EECS 127, do any of the courses allow time conflict?
history.subject: EECS 16B not allow time conflict???
